emotions_basic.title: Feeling Faces: Identifying Basic Emotions
learning_objectives: I can identify happy, sad, mad, and scared emotions
I can match facial expressions to emotion words
I can point to where I feel emotions in my body
emotions_basic.mr_rogers_connection: Episode 1478 - Angry Feelings: How we can recognize different feelings
emotions_basic.warm_up_activity: Look in the emotion mirror and make different feeling faces

main_activities.name: Emotion Face Match
main_activities.description: Match emotion words to facial expression cards

main_activities.name: Body Mapping
main_activities.description: Draw where you feel each emotion in your body

emotions_basic.closing_reflection: How are you feeling right now? Show me with your face and tell me where you feel it.
success_indicators: Points to body locations for emotions
assessment_questions: Show me a happy face. Where do you feel happy in your body?
What emotion do you think this person is feeling?
When someone is sad, how can you tell?
extension_activities: Create an emotion book with drawings
Use emotion faces during daily check-ins

emotions_complex.title: More Than Mad: Understanding Complex Emotions
learning_objectives: I can identify frustrated, disappointed, excited, and worried emotions
I can tell the difference between similar feelings
I can use emotion words to describe my experiences
emotions_complex.mr_rogers_connection: Episode 1495 - Making Mistakes: Understanding disappointment and growth
emotions_complex.warm_up_activity: Share about a time you felt really excited about something

main_activities.name: Emotion Sorting
main_activities.description: Sort emotions by intensity using feeling thermometer

main_activities.name: Scenario Discussions
main_activities.description: Discuss what emotions characters might feel in different situations

emotions_complex.closing_reflection: What's one new emotion word you learned today? When might you feel that way?
assessment_questions: How is frustrated different from mad?
What might make someone feel disappointed?
Show me excited vs. happy on the feeling thermometer
extension_activities: Keep an emotion journal for a week
Create emotion stories using new vocabulary

calm_down_strategies.title: Calm Down Tools: Learning to Self-Regulate
learning_objectives: I can use deep breathing to calm down
I can count to 10 when I feel upset
I can ask for help when my emotions feel too big
calm_down_strategies.mr_rogers_connection: Episode 1478 - Angry Feelings: Ways to handle angry feelings
calm_down_strategies.warm_up_activity: Practice belly breathing with your breathing buddy

main_activities.name: Deep Breathing Practice
main_activities.description: Learn 4-7-8 breathing technique with breathing buddy

main_activities.name: Calm Down Menu
main_activities.description: Create personalized calm down strategy cards

calm_down_strategies.closing_reflection: Which calm down strategy feels most helpful for you? When might you use it?
success_indicators: Can count to 10 slowly when prompted
assessment_questions: Show me how to do belly breathing
What can you do when you feel really mad?
Who can you ask for help when emotions feel too big?
extension_activities: Create a calm down corner at home
Teach breathing to a family member

anger_management.title: When I Feel Mad: Healthy Ways to Handle Anger
learning_objectives: I can recognize anger warning signs in my body
I can use appropriate strategies before anger gets too big
I can express anger in ways that don't hurt others
anger_management.mr_rogers_connection: Episode 1478 - Angry Feelings: It's okay to feel angry, but not okay to hurt
anger_management.warm_up_activity: Notice how your body feels when you're calm vs. starting to get upset

main_activities.name: Anger Warning Signs
main_activities.description: Identify physical sensations that signal rising anger

main_activities.name: Anger Scenarios
main_activities.description: Role-play appropriate responses to anger-triggering situations

anger_management.closing_reflection: What's your anger warning sign? What strategy will you try next time?
success_indicators: Demonstrates appropriate anger responses in role-play
assessment_questions: How does your body feel when you start to get mad?
What can you do instead of yelling or hitting?
How can you tell someone you're angry in a respectful way?
extension_activities: Practice anger strategies during peer conflicts

problem_solving_steps.title: Working It Out: Steps for Solving Problems with Friends
learning_objectives: I can identify when there's a problem with a friend
I can use words to tell someone how I feel
I can listen to what others have to say
problem_solving_steps.mr_rogers_connection: Episode 1640 - Making Mistakes: Learning to say sorry and forgive
problem_solving_steps.warm_up_activity: Think of a time you had a problem with a friend. How did it feel?

main_activities.name: Problem-Solving Steps
main_activities.description: Learn the 4-step process: Stop, Talk, Listen, Try Again

main_activities.name: Practice Scenarios
main_activities.description: Practice problem-solving steps with simple friend conflicts

problem_solving_steps.closing_reflection: Which step do you think might be hardest for you? How can you remember to use these steps?
success_indicators: Uses words to express feelings appropriately
assessment_questions: What are the steps for solving problems?
How can you tell someone you're upset without being mean?
What does good listening look like?
extension_activities: Make a problem-solving poster for home
Use steps during actual peer conflicts

perspective_taking.title: In Their Shoes: Understanding How Others Feel
learning_objectives: I can think about how other people might be feeling
I can understand that others might feel differently than I do
I can show caring when someone is upset
perspective_taking.mr_rogers_connection: Episode 1479 - Making Friends: Understanding that everyone has feelings
perspective_taking.warm_up_activity: Look at a picture and guess how each person in it might be feeling

main_activities.name: Story Character Feelings
main_activities.description: Read stories and discuss character emotions and motivations

main_activities.name: Empathy Art
main_activities.description: Draw or create art showing how to help someone who's sad

perspective_taking.closing_reflection: How can you show someone you care about their feelings?
success_indicators: Accurately identifies character emotions in stories
Shows understanding that people can feel differently
assessment_questions: How do you think this character is feeling? Why?
What would you do if you saw someone crying?
How might someone feel different from you in this situation?
extension_activities: Do acts of kindness for family members
